title.value: Sources of Richness and Ineffability for Phenomenally Conscious States
title.justification: This is the title of the research paper provided by the user.
title.quote:
Sources of Richness and Ineffability for
Phenomenally Conscious States

extractions.description: This paper provides an information theoretic dynamical systems perspective on the richness and ineffability of consciousness. It delves into how attractor dynamics in neural networks can explain both the rich detail and the difficulty of describing conscious experiences. The authors argue that richness corresponds to the amount of information in a conscious state, while ineffability corresponds to the information lost during processing. The paper also discusses intra-personal and inter-personal ineffability and offers a formal model to describe these phenomena.

type.justification: The paper mainly builds and explains theoretical models using information theory and dynamical systems to explain the richness and ineffability of conscious states.

name.value: Neural Dynamics and Information Theory in Consciousness Studies
name.justification: The primary focus is on understanding conscious states using neural dynamics and information theory.
name.quote:
In our framework, the richness
of conscious experience corresponds to the amount of information in a
conscious state and ineffability corresponds to the amount of information
lost at different stages of processing. We describe how attractor dynamics
in working memory would induce impoverished recollections of our original
experiences,...

name.justification: The work connects neural processes to cognitive functions and conscious experiences.
name.quote:
Our model assumes that conscious experiences are derived
from neural processes according to known physical laws, and can therefore be
understood using the standard methods of cognitive neuroscience.

name.justification: The paper also addresses longstanding philosophical questions about consciousness, ineffability, and the explanatory gap.
name.quote: Richness and ineffability figure in several important live debates about consciousness in the philosophical literature.
